thread.title: Watch Steph Curry Flex After a Layup, Then Get Destroyed By DeAndre Jordan's Screen
thread.title_full: Watch Steph Curry Flex After a Layup, Then Get Destroyed By DeAndre Jordan's Screen

author: Rob Scott
title: Watch Steph Curry Flex After a Layup, Then Get Destroyed By DeAndre Jordan's Screen

organizations.name: ball core board lunge with kevin durant views

text:
Watch Steph Curry Flex After a Layup, Then Get Destroyed By DeAndre Jordan's Screen Updated: February 03, 2017 Build Basketball Balance and Explosion With Damian Lillard's Single-Leg Dumbbell Combo Views 622,594 Michael Carter-Williams Shoot 'Til You Miss Drill Views 105,555 Med Ball Core Board Lunge With Kevin Durant Views 116,072 Brandon Knight on Turning Around His High School Team Views 166,364 Blake Griffin Interview and Cover Shoot Views 604,533 Eastbay Presents Preparation Nation: Bishop Gorman High School Views 1,513,708 Dwight Howard Benches 365 Pounds Views 516,587 Previous Next Last night, the Golden State Warriors beat the Los Angeles Clippers 133-120. Two-time NBA MVP Steph Curry had a great night , with 29 points, 11 assists and 3 steals. But late in the second quarter, Curry got a little too cockyâ€”and it cost him. 
RELATED: Many Elite Basketball Players Possess These 3 Key Mental Skills Out-hustling two Clippers players, Curry grabbed an offensive rebound and made a wide-open layup to put the Warriors up by 12. He was feeling good and decided to show off by flexing his biceps. As you can imagine, that didn't make the Clippers happy. They took it as a taunt. On the next possession, the Clippers' 6-foot-11, 265-pound center DeAndre Jordan came up behind the 6-foot-3, 190-pound Curry and set a hard screen. The move sent a clear message that his opponents did not appreciate his juvenile gesture. Curry got the message as he collapsed to the floor. Lesson learned: if you taunt the home team, keep your head on a swivel.
